intro: Niphobolus sheareri, commonly known as the Shearer's niphobolus, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the summer months. Niphobolus sheareri is typically found in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
